name: Baked Eggplant Parmesan
author: Dollface
summary: Eggplant slices are coated with bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese and baked between layers of tomato sauce and mozzarella cheese for a filling Italian-inspired meal. Add fresh garlic and basil to taste. I use 2 to 4 cloves fresh garlic and 5 to 10 leaves of freshly harvested basil in the sauce. Fresh basil layered in one of the layers adds lots of 'fresh' flavor!
ingredients: 2  eggplant, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch slices
1 (16 ounce) package shredded mozzarella cheese, or as needed
directions: Place eggplant slices in a colander; sprinkle both sides of each slice with salt
Allow to sit for at least 3 hours
Wipe excess moisture from eggplant slices with paper towels
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Mix bread crumbs and 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese together in a bowl
Dip eggplant slices in beaten egg; coat with bread crumb mixture
Arrange coated eggplant slices in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned and crisp, about 5 minutes per side
Cover the bottom of a 9x13-inch casserole dish with a layer of spaghetti sauce; top with a layer of eggplant slices
Sprinkle with about 1 tablespoon of the remaining Parmesan cheese and 1/3 the mozzarella cheese
Repeat layers with remaining ingredients, ending with a cheese layer
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is bubbling and golden brown, about 35 minutes
